sentences.en: a young face full of radiance
sentences.cn: 一张光彩照人的年轻脸庞

sentences.en: Gerty sparkled too, or at least shone with a tempered radiance.
sentences.cn: 葛泰本人也焕发着光彩,一种温和的,适度的光彩.

sentences.en: He looked up again at the full moon, bathing the night with its limitless radiance.
sentences.cn: 他又抬起头望天空.他望着那一轮散布无限光辉的明月.

sentences.en: He wanted to fill his soul's lungs with the pure radiance.
sentences.cn: 他盼望那纯净的光辉能够洒遍他的灵魂深处.

sentences.en: Her mortal frame could not endure the splendors of the immortal radiance.
sentences.cn: 她那世人的肉身禁不住炽热的神光.

sentences.en: Humboldt wanted to drape the world in radiance.
sentences.cn: 洪堡想把世界装饰得光彩夺目.

sentences.en: It was more than a smile, and almost a radiance.
sentences.cn: 那不仅仅是微笑, 还几乎是容光的焕发.

sentences.en: It'seemed strange that such barrenness could exhibit this radiance of color.
sentences.cn: 说来真怪,在这个不毛之地居然呈现出这种灿烂的颜色.

sentences.en: She has the vigour and radiance of someone young enough to be her grand-daughter.
sentences.cn: 她拥有与孙女辈的年轻人一样的活力和容光。

sentences.en: She seemed to shine with an inner radiance.
sentences.cn: 她发自内心地高兴,脸上好像也有了光彩.

sentences.en: The dim bulb of the bedside lamp cast a soft radiance over his face.
sentences.cn: 床头灯朦胧的光柔和地投射在他脸上。

sentences.en: The lake and the hills add radiance and beauty to each other.
The radiance of new - blown roses, can I compare it to yours?
sentences.cn: 新盛开的玫瑰花啊! 我是否可将它比喻作你 呢 ?

sentences.en: Then somewhere in the night a radiance again , like a vapour.
sentences.cn: 苍茫的夜色,躁动的浮云,斑驳的月光,褐色月晕, 浑然成为一体.

sentences.en: There was about her a new radiance.
What we needed was a new radiance altogether.
sentences.cn: 我们需要的则是一种全新的光辉.

words.tran_cn: 辐射的；容光焕发的；光芒四射的
辐射；流露；发光；从中心向各方伸展
辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播

phrases.tran_cn: 光谱辐射（强度）；光谱辐射率

trans.tran_cn: 发光，光辉，辐射，欣喜的神色
